attributes.action: Replace Andrew Bailey as the “Governor” for the BoE
attributes.additional_details: A serious debate in parliament about the future autonomy of the Bank of England in the long term. In the short term Andrew Bailey’s position as “Governor” should be reviewed as a matter of urgency.
attributes.background: The Bank of England has continuously FAILED to keep inflation at around 2%. The BoE has then used the  primary mechanism of increasing interest rates for thirteen consecutive occasions as a pathetic measure to control inflation. This has heaped misery upon millions of homeowner with mortgages.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about honours or appointments. This includes requests for the Government to replace the Governor of the Bank of England.

You could raise your concerns with your local MP or the Government department responsible for monetary policy.

You can find contact details for your local MP here: https://members.parliament.uk/FindYourMP

And you can find contact details for HM Treasury here: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/hm-treasury
